body.p: To his Excellency Tho E. Bramblett Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Mary Hollar says that at the September Term 1864 of the Nicholas Circuit Court she was convicted of the offense of Keeping a Tippling House & adjudged to pay a fine of Sixty Dollars -- She & her husband are very poor having a family of children to support & can not without prejudice to the welfare & sustenance of their family pay said fine.
She prays your Excellency to interpose & remit said fine except costs & so

The undersigned citizens of Nicholas County respectfully represent to his Excellency the Governer of Kentucky that the applicatins of Mrs, Hollar presents a Meritorious claim for Executive clemency -- Mr Mrs Hollar are poor persons -- have a family to support -- and quiet industrious persons, of good moral character & are wholly free from any dissipated or vicious habits, The sale of the whiskey by the wife was made by her with no purpose to violate any law but under a Misapprehension of the law on the subject -- We earnestly reccomend that the fine be remitted,

R J R Tilton
W. W. Howard clk Nicholas
Circuit Ct.
Jno A. Campbell clk
County Court
Wm. P. Ross
John, M, Chevis
Fitch Mungro
Peyton S Adair
E Howe

The undersigned the Jury who rendered the verdict at the September Term 1864 of the Nicholas Circuit Court in the suit of the Commonwealth agt Mary Hallar upon an indictment for Keeping a Tippling house earnestly but respectfully petition His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky to remit the fine adjudged in said case except costs -- The pecliar hardship of the case justify such an interposition

Sept 20 1864
H, M, Bell
Luis Saldd Atty
W A Sims
J. P. Ross
John Stoops
Regin Talburt
J. P. Potts
Wm. H. Waugh

Nicholas Cir Ct
vs
Mary Hollar
$60,
Remitted
4th Jany/65
